com.team08storyapp

Class StoryController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.team08storyapp.StoryController

  • public class StoryController
extends java.lang.Object
    StoryController is a controller class that manipulates data of story objects. This class allows for us to read story, read the story fragments related to that story and allows us to add story fragments on to a story.

    For the purpose of this application, this class does the following:

    • Reading the story.
    • Getting a specific Story Fragment by using Story Fragment Id.
    • Adding a Story Fragment to a story.
    • Adding a Choice to a Story Fragment.
    • Connecting two Story Fragments together.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Michele Paulichuk, Alice Wu, Ana Marcu, Jarrett Toll, Jiawei Shen
    See Also:
    Story, StoryFragment, Choice

        public StoryController()

    • Method Detail

      • readStoryFragment

        public static StoryFragment readStoryFragment(java.util.ArrayList<StoryFragment> storyFragments,
                              int storyFragmentId)
        ReadStoryFragment method passing in an Arraylist of Story Fragment object and a Story Fragment Id. It goes through the ArrayList finding the next story fragment comparing the Story Fragment Id. The method then returns the next story fragment in line.
        Parameters:
        storyFragments - Array List of Story Fragment objects that relates to the current story.
        storyFragmentId - An integer which uniquely identifies a Story Fragment.
        Returns:
        The Story Fragment that is supposed to be next in the story.

      • addStoryFragment

        public static Story addStoryFragment(StoryFragment addStoryFragment,
                     Story story)
        Allows for an Authors creation of a StoryFragment to be added to the Story they are working on.
        Parameters:
        addStoryFragment - The Story Fragment that was created to add to the Story.
        story - The Story the Author is creating by adding Story Fragments to.
        Returns:
        The Story now containing the new Story Fragment.

      • addChoice

        public static StoryFragment addChoice(java.lang.String choiceText,
                      StoryFragment storyFragment1,
                      int storyFragment2Id)
        Allows for an Author's creation of a Choice to be added to the Story Fragment they are working on. By adding a Choice the Author is connecting two Story Fragments together.
        Parameters:
        choice - The Choice the Author has created for the Story Fragment.
        storyFragment - The Story Fragment that the Choice is being added to.
        storyFragment2 - The Story Fragment that the Choice leads to.
        Returns:
        The Story Fragment with the newly added Choice.

      • feelingLucky

        public static int feelingLucky(int storyListSize)
        This method takes the size of a list of Stories and returns a random number that symbolizes the Story index of one of the Stories in the list. This Story index is used to find and display a random Story for the user. This method would be used with a "I'm Feeling Lucky!" button in a list of Stories to read. The user presses the button which calls this method and takes the size of the list of Stories displayed to the user. Then the method returns to the calling code the Story Id of the Story to retrieve and display to the user.
        Parameters:
        storyListSize - The size of the List of Stories that the user is getting a random Story from.
        Returns:
        The Story index for the random Story to display to the user from the list of Stories.

      • randomChoice

        public static int randomChoice(java.util.ArrayList<Choice> choices)
        This method takes in an Array list of choices. It returns a random story fragment ID of a possible fragment that the current story fragment might go to. Example: If there is a fragment that has choices a,b,c, each of them leading to different fragments through toGoToStoryFragmentID. This method will then choose one of these possible choices at random and return that fragment ID.
        Parameters:
        Choices - An array list of choice objects containing all the possible choices of the fragment.
        Returns:
        The next story fragment ID that the randomChoice chose out of the possible choices.

      • updateStoryFragment

        public static Story updateStoryFragment(Story story,
                        StoryFragment storyFragment,
                        int storyFragmentId,
                        int storyFragmentIndex)
        This method replaces a fragment in a story at a particular index, or adds it to the story if it does not exist. It takes a story object, the fragment to be replaced, the id of that fragment, and the index of the fragment in the story fragments list. It returns the updated story object. Example: If the fragment should be at index 10 of the story fragments list, but there are only 10 items in the list (max index 9), the fragment is appended to the story fragments list of the story object.
        Parameters:
        story - A story object.
        storyFragment - The story fragment that should replace an existing fragment at a particular index, or appended to the story fragments list.
        storyFragmentId - The id if the storyFragment parameter. This is used to check if the fragment already exists in the list.
        storyFragmentIndex - This is the position of the fragment in the story fragments list. The fragment replaces the existing fragment at this index.
        Returns:
        The updated story object containing a list of fragments with either a modified fragment, or an additional one.
